overview:
Shane Mac is the Director of Product at Zaarly.

Heâ€™s been featured in The New York Times, Reuters, U.S. News and World and many other press publications discussing new and disruptive ways to get hired.

Shane spearheaded marketing for Seattle based Gist which sold to BlackBerry. Heâ€™s the founder of Hello There, an author, a professional musician voted best wedding band in 2009 and is obsessed with creating technology that can connect people and change the world for the better.

He spends his spare time speaking to college students across the country about disruptive ways to get hired. He can also be found writing articles or interviewing business leaders on a few different blogs including thesquab.com, blog.shanemac.me and asksummit.org.

Shane began his career at The Cobalt Group on a team which developed a mass scale concept to deliver hyper-local advertising campaigns to every dealer website for top tier auto brands such as Chevy, Buick, GMC, Cadillac, Volkswagon and Lexus. Cobalt was acquired by ADP.

He graduated with a degree in Finance and Economics from Western Illinois University.
